text: Portugal man hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here the Internet's
manliest music nerd and the album review
Portugal the man in the mountain in the
cloud this is the second time I'm
reviewing something from this Alaskan
band on this YouTube channel but this is
definitely not my second run-in with
them I've been following them since I
got turned on to their LP censored
colors in 2008 which actually became one
of my favourite releases of that year
but maybe that album was a bad place to
start because ever since I heard
censored colors I haven't liked anything
Portugal the man has put out since then
I haven't liked any of it for me the
satanic Satanist and especially American
ghetto are the opposite of censored
colors because they're so condensed
they're so shortened they're they're
simplified they're plainly structured
too much to really give me the same rush
of energy that the songs on censored
colors did and for me this album returns
to a little bit the same ambition and
big production experience that I fell on
censored colors on this album Portugal
the man really let's it's David Bowie
influences fly to drumming up something
that is equal parts psychedelic rock
glam rock indie and baroque pop nearly
all of these flavors hit on the very
first track of the album with these
guitar chords syncopated with the drums
this big joyous bright rock chorus a lot
of strings tightly wound around this
chorus too and just a lot of
instrumentation backing the song up in
general it kind of felt like something I
could hear t-rex doing but the style
that the band goes for on that track
they don't vary too far from it on a lot
of these songs it's kind of like hearing
the same
thing executed again and again and again
and again and not that that's the worst
thing in the world but some moments were
clearly more exciting than others for me
and still Portugal demand is is not
ready to give up its desire to condense
its songs they want to throw more
instrumentation in more layers more
everything but they don't want to give
these tracks more time to grow and
breathe and explore like on the track
floating I'm barely getting a taste of
the verses on this song because I'm
hearing the ooo chorus so many times not
only that but but but a lot of these
choruses sound pretty similar similar
two songs these guys have written in the
past and songs that are on this album as
I'm listening to a hook on this LP I
hear memories of other ones echoing in
my mind and this is something that
usually goes away as I listen to an
album more and more oh some of the
tracks sound the same I'll listen more
I'll learn and I'll hear the differences
in the subtleties but the more I listen
to this thing the stronger that feeling
became still that's that's just my
opinion and and there definitely are
tracks on here that stick out for me
God it all is a great single for this
album it's passionate it's invigorating
it's a great use of the strings that
Portugal the man broked this album out
with and the verses have the perfect and
the verses have a great amount of
breathing room and do I hear some bongos
in the background of this track if if I
do nice touch the track all your light
just brings things down lets things
simmer it's a great kind of lower darker
point that I wish this album had more
tracks like there's a spot of acoustic
ballad Rhian once was one and my
favorite track which shouldn't be hard
to figure out if you've been listening
to my gripes is the last one which
clocks in at 6 minutes this track takes
its time introducing the vocals the
electric guitar the swelling strings the
cymbal rolls before it falls into a
groove and then it saves it's all
an explosion for the end and I just find
that much more gratifying than three to
five semi explosions in one single track
though this LP is a step in the right
direction I just found too many
similarities between a lot of these
tracks to really kind of want me to
return to them again and again again and
I'm not talking about instrumentally I
mean Portugal demand is usually pretty
good on this LP about kind of featuring
spotlighting a different instrument in
each song what I'm talking about here is
melody chord progression and key I'm
feeling a decent two strong six on this
LP I know that isn't an exciting number
for some of you but it's exciting to me
actually because I haven't liked
anything these guys have done since
censored colors to find myself at least
digging this LP a little bit is nice
what do you think of this LP love it
hate it why what should i review next
you're the best thank you for watching
Anthony Fantana Portugal the man forever
you
